availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Vanhoose (Johnson County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Johnson County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Minerva Vanhoose. Father of Matilda Vanhoose, Elizabeth A. Vanhoose, John W. Vanhoose, Nancy J. Vanhoose, Mary Vanhoose, Elijah Vanhoose, H. W. Vanhoose, Sarah A. Vanhoose, Levy Vanhoose, and James H. Vanhoose. Farmer in Johnson County in 1850 and 1860. First lieutenant in the 65th Regiment of Kentucky Militia in Johnson County in 1864.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 102A; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 120-21; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, Barnetts Creek Precinct, p. 11; Find A Grave, "William Clark Bryan Vanhoose (1821-1907)," Memorial #160486998, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=160486998&ref=acom (accessed June 12, 2017).
